intro: Cyathula uncinulata var. abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian spurge, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, cup-shaped cyathium inflorescence. The plant features alternate, ovate leaves with a rough texture and produces small, yellowish-green flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
